comments:
3rd party xml parser might make eclipse not working & cause a misleading error.

"Out-of-teh-box" eclipse didn't start. The error was !MESSAGE Error installing
bundle: reference:file:/.../eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.update.configurator_3.0.0/

The reason was i had a 3rd party xml parser installed that eclipse tried to use,
but was unsuccessful for some reasons (the 3rd party lib broken i guess).
.....
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
   at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.PluginParser.endElement(PluginParser.java:262)
   at com.caucho.xml.XmlParser.popNode(XmlParser.java:915)
   at com.caucho.xml.XmlParser.closeTag(XmlParser.java:802)
   at com.caucho.xml.XmlParser.parseNode(XmlParser.java:358)
   at com.caucho.xml.XmlParser.parseInt(XmlParser.java:240)
   at com.caucho.xml.AbstractParser.parse(AbstractParser.java:634)
.....

Could you attach the full log for that session? Providing a section of the
log/stacktrace is ok if you provide the complete information as an attachment.

Created an attachment (id=18716)
Log after the crash.

As you guessed, it is a bug in Resin's XMLcom.caucho.xml.XmlParser:

http://www.caucho.com/quercus/bugtrack/view.xtp?bugreport_id=2531

Tehre is nothing we can do. We cannot protect ourselves against every bug we
know in specific parser implementations.

I understand. I'll try to get this info into a faq or smthing. I was battling
with getting eclipse working and none of the info i could find online suggested
anything like that.

The problem is more that when checking the log file (113 lines) one can see 3
errors that don't lead anywhere.

!MESSAGE Error installing bundle:
!MESSAGE Product org.eclipse.platform.ide could not be found.
!MESSAGE Application error

I guess this "bug" will at least appear on a search engine now.
